title: Performance-Confidence Analysis Microlearning for Physics Mechanics Misconception Detection

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational physics concepts (force, motion, energy) at an advanced level
context.additional_context: A process of simultaneously diagnosing epidemiological problem-solving skills and conceptual understanding in a smartphone-based learning environment

learning_goals: Acquiring the ability to use a self-assessment confidence scoring system after solving mechanics problems
Developing techniques to identify misconceptions by analyzing discrepancy patterns between performance (accuracy) and confidence (self-assessment)
Achieving over 80% accuracy in diagnosing conceptual errors through Rasch model-based transformed score interpretation

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
